description: System-generated unique identifier for this level-2 organizational unit (e.g., department) within the fleet hierarchy.
Audit timestamp for this record’s creation or last update, stored as a yyyymmddHHMMSSmmm-style string; used for synchronization and change tracking.
Identifier of the unit’s manager/supervisor in the master personnel table; used to route approvals and communications; confirm exact source table with SME.
Reference metadata indicating which table the manager/supervisor identifier points to (e.g., personnel table); helps resolve cross-database foreign keys.
State or province associated with the unit’s address, likely stored as a foreign key to a states lookup; confirm with SME.
Reference metadata indicating which table the state value uses for lookup (e.g., states/provinces table).
Foreign key to the parent level-1 organizational unit under which this unit resides.
Reference metadata specifying the table or view for the parent unit identifier.
Primary email address for the unit, used for notifications and contact.
Fax number for the unit’s office, if maintained.
Primary telephone number for the unit’s office.
Postal or ZIP code for the unit’s address.
City for the unit’s mailing or physical address.
Second address line (suite, floor, building) for the unit.
Primary street address for the unit’s location.
Name of the level-2 organizational unit (department/division) within the fleet hierarchy; used for display and reporting.
Short code or identifier for the level-2 unit, used in forms, integrations, and reporting.
Website URL for the unit, if available.
Free-text notes about the unit (e.g., operating details or internal remarks).
Binary image blob associated with the unit, such as a logo or photo.
Indicates whether the unit is inactive or retired; True means inactive.
Original identifier for this unit from a legacy system, used for data migration and cross-referencing.
Name of the legacy source table from which this unit originated.
